climbs.name: Watchtower AKA Last Temptation
climbs.fa: Chris Dunn and Jim Erdman,1992, FFA John Mattson, J. Burcham,1998

content.description: Super Classic dihedral on the Watchtower formation.  Goes from crimps, to tips, to ever widening hands at the end of pitch one.  Hardly anybody does the second pitch, and there is a pretty good reason for that.
content.protection: A #00 TCU and then doubles through #2 Camalot.
content.location: It is really right there on your left if you are facing the Church Wall proper.  Hard to miss!!

content.description: Between The Locomotion and Poop Tube.
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches. Anchors at top.
content.location: Between The Locomotion and Poop Tube.

content.description: This route climbs the most obvious corner/crack system in the middle of the Lower Religion Wall.  The route starts as fingers then opens to hands before mantling onto a flake.  (The flake, while scary, has been jumped up and down on, beaten with a hammer, etc.)  From here climb the awkward slot above to where the crack splits.  The left finish is fingers in a corner and goes at 5.10+.  The right finish climbs broken rock to a short hand crack through the limestone band to a two bolt rap anchor.
content.protection: 2 x Blue Metolius (Met) TCU 2 x Yellow Met TCU 2 x .5 Camalot (old sizes) 2 x .75 Camalot 2 x 1 Camalot 2 x 2 Camalot 1-2 x 3 Camalot 2 x 5 CamalotÂ  Medium to Large Stoppers Slings and Draws 2 Bolt Rap Anchor at top
content.location: This route is basically in the middle of the Lower Religion Wall.  To descend, rap from a two bolt anchor.

content.description: this route probably has another name...?   climb thin unprotected face to flare to thin face then short hand crack to anchors below Broken Arete
content.location: Face located between Brown Hornet and Poop    Chute.

content.description: Very varied climbing: OW to chimney to roof to finger and hand cracks, past a bolt on face to finger lieback finish!
content.location: Left end of the Lower Religion wall,  Right of the Last Temptation (Watchtower).

content.description: This route follows a line of bolts up a corner/groove system.  6-8 bolts plus a two bolt rap anchor.
content.protection: 6-8 bolts plus a two bolt rap anchor.
content.location: This route is located just left of Cat Claw.  It is marked by an obvious corner/groove system and line of bolts.  Rap from a two bolt anchor to the ground.

content.description: A steep, funky, start (crux) climbs past several bolts to a fun slab finish.  6-8 bolts to a two bolt rap anchor.
content.protection: 6-8 draws plus gear for the two bolt rap anchor.
content.location: This route is the last line on the right hand end of the Lower Religion Wall.  The start is marked by a beaten down cat claw plant.

content.description: This route is the first line of bolts left of Centipede.  The route starts easy, then the crux comes at about 2/3s height when making balance moves on small holds.
content.protection: 6-8 bolts plus a two bolt rap anchor.
content.location: This is the first route to the left of Centipede.  Descent is by rappel from a two bolt anchor.

content.description: The Lower Religion Wall is composed of the darker red/brown wall to the right of the Watchtower.  There is a nice mix of trad and sport routes in this area.  One 60m rope will be plenty to get you up and down the routes on this wall.  This wall has full sun from morning through the middle of the afternoon.
